column1: #Text=[0157] Referring back to FIG. 18, when the reverse acceleration recognition processing at the step S4 is terminated, next, the CPU 10 executes stability determination processing (the step S5).

#Text=In this processing, as described with reference to FIG. 16, a determination is made as to whether or not the acceleration which has shifted across the waiting threshold value has returned to the vicinity of the origin.
#Text=[0158] FIG. 29 is a flow chart showing in detail the stability determination processing shown at the step S5.
#Text=As shown in FIG. 29, the CPU 10 sets "0" at the timer 135 (a step S71).
#Text=Then, the CPU 10 adds "1" to the timer 135 (a step S72).
#Text=[0159] Next, the CPU 10 executed difference acceleration calculation processing as described above (a step S73).
#Text=This processing is the same as the processing at the step S23, and hence the description thereof will be omitted.

#Text=[0160] Next, the CPU 10 determines whether or not a magnitude of difference acceleration calculated at the step S73 is smaller than the value of the stability threshold value data 132 (a step S74).
#Text=In other words, the CPU 10 determines whether or not the acceleration has shifted to the inside (the origin side) of the circle 104 as shown in FIG. 6.

#Text=As a result of the determination, when the magnitude of the difference acceleration is smaller than the value of the stability threshold value data 132 (YES at the step S74), the stability determination processing is terminated.

#Text=[0161] On the other hand, when the magnitude of the difference acceleration is not smaller than the value of the stability threshold value data 132 (NO at the step S74), the CPU 10 determines whether or not the timer 135 is larger than the time limit (a step S75).

#Text=In other words, for the same purpose as the above step S66, a determination is made as to whether or not the time limit has elapsed before the acceleration shifts to the stability threshold value.

#Text=As a result of the determination, when the timer 135 is larger than the time limit (YES at the step S75), namely, when the time limit has elapsed before the acceleration shifts to the stability threshold value, the stability determination processing is terminated.
#Text=On the other hand, when the timer 135 is not larger than the time limit, namely, when the time limit has not elapsed (NO at the step S75), the CPU 10 returns to the processing at the step S72.
#Text=This is the end of the description of the stability determination processing.
